active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the balance between stringent authorization processes for maintenance personnel (per NIST MA-5) and the need for rapid operational maintenance in a high-availability environment. Reference specific MA-5 requirements (e.g., verification, escorting) and cite real-world breach examples like vendor access failures (e.g., SolarWinds supply chain incident or Target's HVAC vendor breach).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education, focusing on 'Maintenance Personnel Authorization' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information Systems Security Capabilities > Security Operations > Security Maintenance > Maintenance Personnel Authorization). Base all content strictly on NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 MA-5 (full control: a. criteria; b. authorize; c. verify; d. document; e. terminate; f. external handling), enhancements (MA-5(1) escorting/tools, MA-5(2) transfer), PE-2, and integrations (AC-6, IA-5). Complete coverage: internal/external personnel, supervision (escorted access, double-escort for sensitive, tool checks, record-keeping, audits). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list from JSON above] - Active Learning: Design flashcards to support discussion (e.g., risk trade-offs), peer teaching (explain/teach-back), problem-solving (scenarios). - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards across 4 layers [insert full layers from JSON above]. Generate a JSON array of 25 flashcards following EXACT schema [insert schema structure from JSON above]. Use snake_case keys. Ensure high-quality: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, university-level (Bloom's progression). Distractors: exactly 3 per card, plausible (e.g., 'No escort needed for external if NDA signed' - wrong, per MA-5(1)). Front/Back optimized for Anki/Quizlet. Explanation: 2-4 sentences, cite NIST (e.g., 'MA-5 requires...'), link to objectives/layers. Vary Bloom's: 5 remember, 7 understand/apply, 7 analyze, 6 evaluate/create. Voter consensus: 100% approval on completeness/pedagogy.
